title: Nearly one in five young women in France do not identify as heterosexual: 'Even now, I can't tell if I'm more attracted to women or men'
summary: 19% of French women aged 18 to 29 do not define themselves as heterosexual today, according to a new study on intimate relationships among young people.

title: Sovereignty, economy, security: Ukraine's mounting challenges in the face of demographic decline
summary: Since the beginning of the war, the country has been drastically losing inhabitants, predicting an uncertain future.

title: Trump and Gulf monarchs see eye to eye in the Middle East
summary: A nuclear deal with Iran, a ceasefire in Gaza, the lifting of sanctions against Syria. Trump's strategy seems to align with the Gulf monarchs' model: Stability, security through development and the promise of billions of dollars in investments in the United States. Israel, isolated, finds itself caught off guard.

title: Haiti's capital without power since Tuesday after protest halts hydroelectric plant
summary: Protesters demanding protection from gang violence forced the shutdown of Haiti's largest hydroelectric plant, a move the national power utility condemned as 'heinous' sabotage.

title: Portugal's far right leads among youth ahead of legislative elections
summary: Portuguese voters head back to the polls on Sunday, just a year after the last legislative elections, following the fall of the center-right government led by Luis Montenegro.

title: Seventeen French delights for Europe's Night of Museums
summary: This Saturday, over 3,000 museums in France and across Europe are opening their doors for free. Le Monde has selected unique events and visits to enjoy throughout France.

title: US Supreme Court defends birthright citizenship, challenged by Trump administration
summary: The Supreme Court heard arguments on the reform of birthright citizenship, as decided by the American president in an executive order that was blocked by several federal judges.

title: Cannes Film Festival: Emotions run high at screening of documentary on photojournalist Fatma Hassona, killed in Gaza
summary: 'Put Your Soul on Your Hand and Walk,' an important documentary by Sepideh Farsi, presented at the Cannes Film Festival on Thursday, immortalizes the young woman who documented daily life in the Palestinian enclave.

title: The number of people facing the risk of famine worldwide has doubled in a year
summary: In 2024, nearly 300 million people in 53 countries analyzed were facing a food crisis, warned the latest edition of the 'Global Report on Food Crises.'

title: War in Ukraine: Direct talks between Moscow and Kyiv yield major prisoner swap
summary: The two countries announced a 1,000-prisoner exchange following direct talks in Istanbul, yet discussions over a ceasefire and a potential Putin-Zelensky meeting produced no breakthrough.

title: US federal judge strikes down guidance on transgender worker protections
summary: A Texas judge has invalidated parts of a Biden-era workplace harassment guidance, including matters like pronoun use and bathroom access.

title: Salman Rushdie attacker sentenced to 25 years in prison
summary: Hadi Matar was found guilty of attempted murder and assault in February for stabbing the prizewinning author more than a dozen times during a lecture in 2022, leaving Rushdie blind in one eye.

title: Council of Europe accuses Israel of deliberate starvation in Gaza
summary: The Council warned that Israel's actions risk fueling future conflict, while the UN rights chief condemned the escalating offensive and blockade as tantamount to ethnic cleansing.

title: Swedish journalist jailed in Turkey for insulting Ergodan is being released and repatriated
summary: Detained in March in Istanbul, Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson confirmed that the Dagens ETC reporter is en route to Sweden.

title: Trendy tycoon Tyler Brûlé opens a café-bookshop in Paris
summary: This Canadian, who launched the trend-setting magazine 'Wallpaper' in the 1990s, now heads 'Monocle,' a leading publication in media, fashion and advertising. The journalist-entrepreneur has just opened his first café-bookstore in Paris.

title: At the trial of pedophile doctor Le Scouarnec, the victims' growing desire to be heard
summary: Since February 24, the criminal court in Brittany has been hearing the case against the former surgeon accused of rape and sexual assault against 299 patients. The testimonies before the court have encouraged other victims to come forward and join the plaintiffs.

title: Poland's presidential campaign ends in Trump's shadow
summary: The first round of voting on Sunday pits the pro-European liberal mayor of Warsaw, Rafal Trzaskowski, favorite in the polls, against an ultra-conservative rival, Karol Nawrocki, who is playing the American card.

title: French crypto boss hails 'heroic' duo who foiled kidnap attempt on his family
summary: On Tuesday, four masked men attacked the pregnant daughter of Paymium CEO Pierre Noizat, her husband and their child in Paris. France's interior held an emergency meeting with sector leaders on Friday, with the ministry announcing plans to bolster their security.

title: Trump slams Supreme Court after justices block deportations of Venezuelans
summary: The court argued that migrants weren't given enough time to challenge their removals in court.

title: The Maison Manara and the beauty of taking it slow in Italy’s Puglia region
summary: In a village at the 'boot heel' of Italy, a French couple enamored of the country has elegantly renovated a charming 1930s house. It offers an authentic setting, far from urban hustle, near the Ionian Sea.

title: In search of flamboyant French film producer Pierre Edelman
summary: In the 1990s, producer Pierre Edelman knew everyone. His connections even allowed him to play a role in the making of some of the greatest films by David Lynch and Pedro Almodóvar. But the dandy in a white suit had a shadowy side, so much so that almost no one noticed when he disappeared.

title: Israeli military says it is launching new phase of Gaza offensive
summary: At least 100 Palestinians were killed by Israel in a single day on Friday as part of what the military described as an expanded offensive.

title: India-Pakistan: 'The Kashmir crisis embodies the incomplete nature of the partition between the two nations'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Jean-Luc Racine, an expert on India, analyzes the historical roots of the conflict between the two regional powers, reignited on April 22 by the Pahalgam attack.

title: Walking briskly: A simple remedy to maintain a healthy heart rate
summary: 'Ten thousand steps and beyond.' A study conducted on participants from the British Biobank cohort has shown the effects of walking on arrhythmia prevention, with even more pronounced effects if the pace is brisk.

title: Study finds intestinal microbiota tests unreliable
summary: A research team sent the same stool sample to six companies. The results varied from one company to another.

title: Jason Furman, former Barack Obama adviser: 'So many of Trump's goals are contradictory'
summary: The trade war waged by Donald Trump, although chaotic, is not likely to plunge the United States into a recession, according to Harvard economics professor Jason Furman, speaking in an interview with 'Le Monde.'

title: At Eurovision, Swedish-speaking Finns are representing Sweden
summary: The three members of KAJ, the band selected to represent Sweden in the 2025 edition of the music contest, hail from a Swedish-speaking minority on Finland's West coast. In a context of hostility toward this second national language and rivalry with their Scandinavian 'big brother,' this is a notable event in Finland.
